text: Aegires citrinus is a species of sea slug, a nudibranch, a marine, opisthobranch gastropod mollusk in the family Aegiridae.Bouchet, P. (2015). Aegires citrinus. In: MolluscaBase (2017). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species on 2017-04-24. ==Distribution== This species was described from New Caledonia. It is common in Eastern Australia and known from the Philippines. Aegris citrinus has also been found at Cabilao Island, Philippines. == Description == Aegris Citrinus is a nudibranch whose length averages about 14 mm. Its coloration may be translucent, white, or a bright yellow. This depends on the sponges it eats. ==References== Category:Aegiridae Category:Gastropods described in 1930
title: Aegires citrinus
